messages.content: I (A) have a former classmate (B) who lives in the city I want to move to next month and would like to ask them something about that city. Unfortunately, I do not have their mobile number to send them a text message, but I know a mutual classmate (C) who can contact B. Please give me an example text message A could write to C to ask them to put A with B in contact.

Here's an example text message that A could write to C:

"Hey C, hope you're doing well. I'm planning to move to [city name] next month and I was wondering if you could help me out. I used to be in the same class with [B], who now lives in that city. I'd really appreciate it if you could connect us so I can ask them some questions about the city. Let me know if that's something you can do. Thanks!"

That's good, but let's get a bit more precise. Let uns call the city "Thecity". In the message, A should ask C to share A's mobile number with B and ask B to get in contact with A only if they are willing to do so. Of course, C should explain B the reason why A wants to get in contact with B.

Sure, here's a revised text message that A could send to C:

"Hey C, hope you're doing well. I'm planning to move to Thecity next month and I was wondering if you could help me out. I used to be in the same class with [B], who now lives in Thecity. I'd really appreciate it if you could share my mobile number with them so I can ask them some questions about the city. I'm only willing to contact them if they are willing to get in touch with me. Let me know if that's something you can do. Thanks!"

Please reformulate it a bit. In the text message, A should ask C if they could request B to get in contact with A and share A's mobile number with B in order to do so. A should mention in their message to C that B should of course only contact A if B is willing to do so (or the message should at least make clear in nice words that A does not want to build preasure for contact through C). A should also ask C to share the reason for A's request: That A wants to move to B's city and has some questions about that.

Sure, here's a revised text message that A could send to C:

"Hey C, hope you're doing well. I'm planning to move to Thecity next month and I was wondering if you could help me out. I used to be in the same class with [B], who now lives in Thecity. I'd really appreciate it if you could ask [B] if they would be willing to share their mobile number with me so I can ask them some questions about the city. I understand that [B] may not be willing to get in touch with me, and I don't want to put any pressure on them. If [B] is willing to contact me, please let me know and I'll happily provide my number. Thanks for your help!"
